name: cashprizes
text: i love this one so much i did the transcription. this is not an invitation to try and do better.

name: brosaurus
text: You are a good person.

name: william
text: Teodor is actually giving a fairly conservative estimate here.  Even if only half of a percent of the world toked, that would mean there are at least 30 perfect Swiss men buying.

name: peterjoel
text: The Swiss don't toke. It's a fact.

name: charchar
text: [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cTuTc_liKS4&feature=related}I beg to differ[/url]

name: charchar
text: You know what I meant BBcode

name: cpnglxynchos
text: i chubbied you for your BBCode backsass.

name: zem
text: Teodor's logic is faulty. You don't need to be a perfect Swiss man to buy from a perfect Swiss joint-rolling company.

name: saint
text: that, and does supply create demand? That seems like backwards thinking to me. Very risky backwards thinking.

name: achilleselbow
text: Sure it does. Think of HDTV and such things. Before they came out, I don't think anyone was sitting around watching their regular TV going "Man, this image quality is terrible - I can't see a thing! When will they finally figure out a way to have a thousand times the pixels?"

name: bjorntd
text:
No joke, that was my dad.

Though he's an engineer.

name: tekende
text:
Yeah, and it's not like there's no demand for such a product. More a case of a product specifically filling a general need/desire.

Like, we've always wanted to be able to take our whole music collection with us in a portable format, but until the ipod came along, we didn't know exactly what format we wanted.

name: dissembly
text: That wasn't "supply" that created the demand, that was advertising and a poor education system.

name: nonemorenegative
text: Indeed; I can see high-end Rap stars and middle-rung wannabes hooking up with Perfect Jays, far more ostentatious than rolling your own with a baggier bought from a white guy with awful dreadlocks.

name: 3n
text: "chemistry people hair" is certainly one of the greatest Achewood lines, ever.

name: petitegitan
text: That or "I've never wanted to start a joint company less in my life".  In this strip, these lines are definitely tied for awesomeness.

name: trevor
text: "I've never wanted to start a joint company less in my life" was also the reason I gave this a 5.

name: soticoto
text: Lyle is clearly the one on the ball there.

name: rasalghul
text: Lyle looks like he's going to offer Ray and T some frittata.

name: ferdinand
text: i was a huge fan of "unforgivingly precise."  wow.

name: nagsworth
text: The whole argument is why I gave this a 5. The conflict is brilliant.

name: i_love_kate
text: I really want to give that comment a five. That irrelevant remark was fantastic.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: yes, ferdie. this is also how i felt.

name: rumblefish
text: Having said that Lyle still wants to start a joint company 68% more than most people.

name: never_die
text: you're such a douche!  get in the established market, you frickin pansy!

name: direhaggis
text: Lyle actually puts down his booze in the last panel to make a point. He's pissed.

name: mortshire
text: It is a perfect...logo!

name: the_doz
text: There is no reason that this should make me laugh as much as it does.

name: tombsgrave
text: "Mexican yeyo boys" are now a general-issue threat when describing a place.  "That Wal-Mart over yonder has crap security, so there's lots of shoplifting.  Also, Mexican yeyo boys will cut you up like a well-share ham sandwich."

name: aperson
text:
"Come on! Compete in the established marketplace, you pussy!"

FIVE.

name: dougthehead
text: indeed.  I've thought of getting a job in marketing simply so I can one day say that to a spiky-haired marketing drone who wets his pants when he hears the word "paradigm shift."

name: deancain29
text: I like Lyle's issues!

name: jesler729
text: Not once has Lyle wanted to start a joint company less than he does right now.

name: nicolae
text: Ah, to light a jay that is unforgivingly precise...

name: stuart
text: This silent comment actually compliments the one before it pretty well.

name: rowboat
text: He's lost in reverie.

name: _cheesekayke
text: This may be my favorite Lyle line ever.

name: clever-nickname
text: Why would the Swiss man's lighter make a crisp click? Swiss people crave silence.

name: zefiel
text:
Ok, I'll try to explain. They'd like silence, sure, but also if your zippo is silent when it opens, it's like it doesn't work, you know? it takes from the experience, and as swiss, they need the experience to be Perfect.

That, and if it was silent you could totally start a lot of accidental fires around.

name: relaxing
text:
Yeyo, or llello , is slang for cocaine .
I learned this listening to Bone Thugz-N-Harmony .

name: philosophe
text: Yay, yak, blow, white, snow, the list goes on just like their flow

name: phthoggos
text: I spent a lot of time thinking about the things that those men said

name: apocowarg
text: as a Vermont resident i can certify that there are many dumbfucks wandering around who fit that logo perfectly.

name: thatcrazycommie
text: Even Lyle has standards.

name: c_dizzle
text:
I hope my hair doesn't look like that when I grow up and become a dealer.

Wait, what?

name: rowboat
text: An over-priced, over-glorified ice cream dealer?

name: varnish
text: Lyle actually seems pretty hurt that Teodor made him look fat. Fat, and equipped with non little orphan annie eyes.

name: hereward
text: but Lyle is fat though?

name: sp1derbaby
text: But that's no reason to draw him fat.

name: beansdooma
text: i need to find some dumbfucks from vermont

name: phthoggos
text: The typeface of the logo is not quite Comic Sans.

name: cherubrocker22
text:
This might be my favorite Achewood.

Also, in case you were wondering, this is the first page that comes up if you Google "unforgivingly precise."

name: xiaomimi
text:
Wednesday Blogs

Lyle: car smoke soon smoke

Today's Blogs

Mr. Bear: I have invented a machine.

name: i_love_kate
text: Mr. Bear is an inventor. Would we know this without the blogs?

name: epicurus
text: If Marijuana was marketed like Ray describes there, I would without a doubt start buying it. I have to say that the idea here might have potential. Could I one day be that man flaming an unforgivingly precise jay?

name: drake
text: I guess neither of them have seen THESE before. I would hate to have to break the news to them, but i guess they wouldn't really be in a position to care, after using it a couple of times.

name: jbushnell
text: Has Teodor ever done a good piece of graphic design? Survey says: no

name: kovatch
text:
I smoke dem J's.

HAHA! AWESOME!

name: erinye
text: Wow, huge burn on Ben and Jerry's out of nowhere.

name: autrepoupee
text: Lyle is so concerned about being portrayed as the fat guy of the partnership.

name: laserblade
text: The Silent Bob, if you will.

name: puguglypress
text: Teodor should stick to cooking.

name: benthecartoon
text: Once again, Ray's business ideas put a bad taste in Lyle's mouth and ruin his dreams of entrepreneurship.  Way to learn your lesson from the Sani-Taco.

name: axtrx
text: I really feel for Lyle in this strip
